## Tender Notification: Dismantling, Fabrication and Installation of a Stainless Steel Wash Unit and Structure

### Announcement Details

* Title: Dismantling, Fabrication and Installation of a New Stainless Steel Wash Unit and the Structure
* Reference Number: cb-779-50275535
* Amendment Number: 3
* Solicitation Number: 21C30-24-4342969
* Publication Date: 2024-02-21
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-03-20 14:00:00
* Amendment Date: 2024-03-20
* Expected Contract Start Date: None
* Expected Contract End Date: None
* Tender Status: Expired

### Project Overview

The Correctional Service of Canada, CORCAN, is seeking a contractor to replace a wash unit in its paint shop located at the Donnacona Institution in Donnacona, Quebec. The project requires the dismantling, fabrication, and installation of a new stainless steel wash unit and the structure.

### Key Project Details

* Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Lowest Price
* Regions of Opportunity: National Capital Region (NCR)
* Regions of Delivery: Quebec (except NCR)
* Contracting Entity: Correctional Service of Canada
* Contracting Authority: Linda Mandeville
* Telephone: 438-357-6503
* Email: linda.mandeville@csc-scc.gc.ca

### Mandatory Site Visit

A mandatory site visit is scheduled for March 6, 2024, at 10:00 a.m. (EST). Bidders are required to attend this visit to familiarize themselves with the site and the project requirements.

### Bidder Requirements

* Bidders must submit their proposals in either English or French.
* The bidding process will be conducted in accordance with the federal procurement process.
* The winning bidder will be selected based on the lowest price quote.
* The project duration is estimated to be 28 weeks from the date of notification of acceptance of the offer.

### Important Notes

* The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.
* Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada.
